string-array.name: product_services
string-array.item: Which products and services are in your existing value proposition?
Which products and services you offer help your customer to get a functional job done?
Which products and services you offer help your customer to get a social job done?
Which products and services you offer help your customer to get a emotional job done?
Which products and services you offer help your customer to satisfy his/her basic needs?

string-array.name: gain_creators
string-array.item: Could your products and services create positive social consequences? By making them look good or producing an increase in power or status.
Could your products and services create savings that please your customers? In terms of time, money, and effort.
Could your products and services outperform current value propositions and delight your customers? Regarding specific features, performance, or quality.
Could your products and services fulfill a desire customers dream about? By helping them achieve their aspirations or getting relief from a hardship?

string-array.name: pain_relievers
string-array.item: Could your products and services make your customers feel better? By killing frustrations, annoyances, and other things that give customers a headache.
Could your products and services wipe out negative social consequences your customers encounter or fear? In terms of loss of face or lost power, trust, or status.
Could your products and services eliminate risks your customers fear? In terms of financial, social, technical risks, or things that could potentially go wrong.
Could your products and services help your customers better sleep at night? By addressing significant issues, diminishing concerns, or eliminating worries.

string-array.name: customer_jobs
string-array.item: What functional problems are your customers trying to solve?
What emotional needs are your customers trying to satisfy?
What does your customer need to accomplish that involves interaction with others?
How does your customer want to feel? What does your customer need to do to feel this way?
What jobs, if completed, would give the user a sense of self-satisfaction?

string-array.name: customer_gains
string-array.item: Which savings would make your customers happy?
How do current value propositions delight your customers?
What positive social consequences do your customers desire?
How do your customers measure success and failure?
What do customers dream about?

string-array.name: customer_pains
string-array.item: What makes your customers feel bad?
What are their frustrations, annoyances, or things that give them a headache?
What negative social consequences do your customers encounter or fear?
What are their big issues, concerns, and worries?
What risks do your customers fear?
Are they afraid of a loss of face, power, trust, or status?
Are they afraid of financial, social, or technical risks, or are they asking themselves what could go wrong?
